text:
We’ve talked about this before. I was happy to share my thoughts with you. You look very pale, Avdotya Romanovna.

"I know his theory. I read that article he wrote about people who think they can do anything. Razumihin brought it to me."

"Mr. Razumihin? Your brother’s article? In a magazine? I didn’t know there was such an article. It must be interesting. But where are you going, Avdotya Romanovna?"

"I want to see Sofya Semyonovna," Dounia said quietly. "How do I get to her? She might be back. I need to see her right away. Maybe she…"

Avdotya Romanovna couldn’t finish her sentence. She was out of breath.

"Sofya Semyonovna won’t be back until tonight. At least, I think so. She was supposed to come back right away, but if not, she’ll be gone for a long time."

"Ah, then you’re lying! I see… you’ve been lying… all this time. I don’t believe you! I don’t believe you!" Dounia shouted, losing control.

Almost fainting, she sat down in a chair that Svidrigaïlov quickly offered her.

"Avdotya Romanovna, what’s wrong? Please calm down! Here’s some water. Drink a little…"

He splashed some water on her. Dounia shivered and started to feel better.

"It had a strong effect," Svidrigaïlov said quietly, looking worried. "Avdotya Romanovna, please calm down! Trust me, he has friends. We will help him. Would you like me to take him abroad? I have money; I can get a ticket in three days."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Avdotya Romanovna is distressed and desperate to see Sofya Semyonovna, believing she may have important news.
